javax.time.temporal

Enum JulianDayField

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<JulianDayField>
      • javax.time.temporal.JulianDayField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<JulianDayField>, Comparator<TemporalAccessor>, TemporalField

    public enum JulianDayField
extends Enum<JulianDayField>
implements TemporalField
    A set of date fields that provide access to Julian Days.

    The Julian Day is a standard way of expressing date and time commonly used in the scientific community. It is expressed as a decimal number of whole days where days start at midday. This class represents variations on Julian Days that count whole days from midnight.

    Implementation notes

    This is an immutable and thread-safe enum.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • JULIAN_DAY

        public static final JulianDayField JULIAN_DAY
        Julian Day field.

        This is an integer-based version of the Julian Day Number. Julian Day is a well-known system that represents the count of whole days since day 0, which is defined to be January 1, 4713 BCE in the Julian calendar, and -4713-11-24 Gregorian. The field has "JulianDay" as 'name', and 'DAYS' as 'baseUnit'. The field always refers to the local date-time, ignoring the offset or zone.

        For date-times, 'JULIAN_DAY.doGet()' assumes the same value from midnight until just before the next midnight. When 'JULIAN_DAY.doWith()' is applied to a date-time, the time of day portion remains unaltered. 'JULIAN_DAY.doWith()' and 'JULIAN_DAY.doGet()' only apply to Temporal objects that can be converted into ChronoField.EPOCH_DAY. A DateTimeException is thrown for any other type of object.

        Astronomical and Scientific Notes

        The standard astronomical definition uses a fraction to indicate the time-of-day, thus 3.25 would represent the time 18:00, since days start at midday. This implementation uses an integer and days starting at midnight. The integer value for the Julian Day Number is the astronomical Julian Day value at midday of the date in question. This amounts to the astronomical Julian Day, rounded to an integer JDN = floor(JD + 0.5). 

          | ISO date          |  Julian Day Number | Astronomical Julian Day |
  | 1970-01-01T00:00  |         2,440,588  |         2,440,587.5     |
  | 1970-01-01T06:00  |         2,440,588  |         2,440,587.75    |
  | 1970-01-01T12:00  |         2,440,588  |         2,440,588.0     |
  | 1970-01-01T18:00  |         2,440,588  |         2,440,588.25    |
  | 1970-01-02T00:00  |         2,440,589  |         2,440,588.5     |
  | 1970-01-02T06:00  |         2,440,589  |         2,440,588.75    |
  | 1970-01-02T12:00  |         2,440,589  |         2,440,589.0     |

        Julian Days are sometimes taken to imply Universal Time or UTC, but this implementation always uses the Julian Day number for the local date, regardless of the offset or time-zone.

      • MODIFIED_JULIAN_DAY

        public static final JulianDayField MODIFIED_JULIAN_DAY
        Modified Julian Day field.

        This is an integer-based version of the Modified Julian Day Number. Modified Julian Day (MJD) is a well-known system that counts days continuously. It is defined relative to astronomical Julian Day as MJD = JD - 2400000.5. Each Modified Julian Day runs from midnight to midnight. The field always refers to the local date-time, ignoring the offset or zone.

        For date-times, 'MODIFIED_JULIAN_DAY.doGet()' assumes the same value from midnight until just before the next midnight. When 'MODIFIED_JULIAN_DAY.doWith()' is applied to a date-time, the time of day portion remains unaltered. 'MODIFIED_JULIAN_DAY.doWith()' and 'MODIFIED_JULIAN_DAY.doGet()' only apply to Temporal objects that can be converted into ChronoField.EPOCH_DAY. A DateTimeException is thrown for any other type of object.

        This implementation is an integer version of MJD with the decimal part rounded to floor.

        Astronomical and Scientific Notes

          | ISO date          | Modified Julian Day |      Decimal MJD |
  | 1970-01-01T00:00  |             40,587  |       40,587.0   |
  | 1970-01-01T06:00  |             40,587  |       40,587.25  |
  | 1970-01-01T12:00  |             40,587  |       40,587.5   |
  | 1970-01-01T18:00  |             40,587  |       40,587.75  |
  | 1970-01-02T00:00  |             40,588  |       40,588.0   |
  | 1970-01-02T06:00  |             40,588  |       40,588.25  |
  | 1970-01-02T12:00  |             40,588  |       40,588.5   |

        Modified Julian Days are sometimes taken to imply Universal Time or UTC, but this implementation always uses the Modified Julian Day for the local date, regardless of the offset or time-zone.

      • RATA_DIE

        public static final JulianDayField RATA_DIE
        Rata Die field.

        Rata Die counts whole days continuously starting day 1 at midnight at the beginning of 0001-01-01 (ISO). The field always refers to the local date-time, ignoring the offset or zone.

        For date-times, 'RATA_DIE.doGet()' assumes the same value from midnight until just before the next midnight. When 'RATA_DIE.doWith()' is applied to a date-time, the time of day portion remains unaltered. 'MODIFIED_JULIAN_DAY.doWith()' and 'RATA_DIE.doGet()' only apply to Temporal objects that can be converted into ChronoField.EPOCH_DAY. A DateTimeException is thrown for any other type of object.

      • getBaseUnit

        public TemporalUnit getBaseUnit()
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Gets the unit that the field is measured in.

        The unit of the field is the period that varies within the range. For example, in the field 'MonthOfYear', the unit is 'Months'. See also TemporalField.getRangeUnit().

        Specified by:
        getBaseUnit in interface TemporalField
        Returns:
        the period unit defining the base unit of the field, not null

      • getRangeUnit

        public TemporalUnit getRangeUnit()
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Gets the range that the field is bound by.

        The range of the field is the period that the field varies within. For example, in the field 'MonthOfYear', the range is 'Years'. See also TemporalField.getBaseUnit().

        The range is never null. For example, the 'Year' field is shorthand for 'YearOfForever'. It therefore has a unit of 'Years' and a range of 'Forever'.

        Specified by:
        getRangeUnit in interface TemporalField
        Returns:
        the period unit defining the range of the field, not null

      • range

        public ValueRange range()
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Gets the range of valid values for the field.

        All fields can be expressed as a long integer. This method returns an object that describes the valid range for that value. This method is generally only applicable to the ISO-8601 calendar system.

        Note that the result only describes the minimum and maximum valid values and it is important not to read too much into them. For example, there could be values within the range that are invalid for the field.

        Specified by:
        range in interface TemporalField
        Returns:
        the range of valid values for the field, not null

      • doIsSupported

        public boolean doIsSupported(TemporalAccessor temporal)
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Implementation of the logic to check if this field is supported by the accessor.

        This method is not intended to be called by application code directly. Applications should use TemporalAccessor.isSupported(TemporalField) on the date-time object passing this as the argument. 

           boolean supported = date.isSupported(field);

        Implementations should be written using the fields available in ChronoField.

        Specified by:
        doIsSupported in interface TemporalField
        Parameters:
        temporal - the temporal object to query, not null
        Returns:
        true if the date-time can be queried for this field, false if not

      • doRange

        public ValueRange doRange(TemporalAccessor temporal)
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Implementation of the logic to get the range of valid values for this field.

        All fields can be expressed as a long integer. This method returns an object that describes the valid range for that value.

        Note that the result only describes the minimum and maximum valid values and it is important not to read too much into them. For example, there could be values within the range that are invalid for the field.

        This method is not intended to be called by application code directly. Applications should use TemporalAccessor.range(TemporalField) on the date-time object passing this as the argument. 

           ValueRange range = date.range(field);

        Implementations should be written using the fields available in ChronoField.

        Specified by:
        doRange in interface TemporalField
        Parameters:
        temporal - the temporal object used to refine the result, not null
        Returns:
        the range of valid values for this field, not null

      • doGet

        public long doGet(TemporalAccessor temporal)
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Implementation of the logic to get the value of this field.

        This method is not intended to be called by application code directly. Applications should use TemporalAccessor.get(TemporalField) or TemporalAccessor.getLong(TemporalField) on the date-time object passing this as the argument. 

           long value = date.get(field);

        The value of the associated field is expressed as a long integer and is extracted from the specified temporal object.

        Implementations should be written using the fields available in ChronoField.

        Specified by:
        doGet in interface TemporalField
        Parameters:
        temporal - the temporal object to query, not null
        Returns:
        the value of this field, not null

      • doWith

        public <R extends Temporal> R doWith(R temporal,
                            long newValue)
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Implementation of the logic to set the value of this field.

        This method is not intended to be called by application code directly. Applications should use Temporal.with(TemporalField, long) on the date-time object passing this as the argument. 

           updated = date.with(field, newValue);

        The new value of the field is expressed as a long integer. The result will be adjusted to set the value of the field.

        Implementations should be written using the fields available in ChronoField.

        Specified by:
        doWith in interface TemporalField
        Parameters:
        temporal - the temporal object to adjust, not null
        newValue - the new value of the field
        Returns:
        the adjusted temporal object, not null

      • resolve

              long value)
        Description copied from interface: TemporalField
        Resolves the date/time information in the builder

        This method is invoked during the resolve of the builder. Implementations should combine the associated field with others to form objects like LocalDate, LocalTime and LocalDateTime

        Parameters:
